alert.note: Alert for Daviess (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 03 at 8:42PM EDT until September 03 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WESTERN DAVIESS COUNTY... At 742 PM CDT, Davies County Central Dispatch relayed that they had received several reports of flooding within the western part of the county. While Doppler radar indicated the heaviest rain has come to an end, light to moderate rain will continue. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain has fallen in a corridor from the western city limits of Owensboro to Sorgho and Rome to West Louisville and St. Joseph. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and law enforcement. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Owensboro, Sorgho, Rome, West Louisville, Stanley, St. Joseph and Moseleyville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
